concise_definition: n. 巡逻, 巡视; v. 巡逻, 巡视

definitions.explanation_en: A regular, systematic movement or circuit made by police, military personnel, or security staff to monitor an area, ensure safety, and deter crime or unauthorized activity.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指警察、军人或安保人员为监控区域、确保安全并阻止犯罪或未经授权的活动而进行的有规律、系统性的巡视路线或行动。
definitions.example_en: The police conducted a nightly patrol around the neighborhood to prevent burglaries.
definitions.example_cn: 警察每晚在社区周围巡逻，以防止入室盗窃。

definitions.explanation_en: A group of personnel assigned to carry out such a movement, or the specific route they follow.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被指派执行巡逻任务的人员群体，或他们所遵循的特定路线。
definitions.example_en: The border patrol was alerted when the sensors detected movement near the fence.
definitions.example_cn: 当传感器检测到围栏附近有移动时，边境巡逻队被警报触发。

definitions.explanation_en: To move regularly through an area, especially for the purpose of maintaining order, security, or surveillance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为了维持秩序、安全或监控而有规律地在某一区域移动。
definitions.example_en: Security guards patrol the building every hour to check for intruders.
definitions.example_cn: 保安每小时巡逻一次大楼，检查是否有入侵者。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a routine inspection or journey, often in a vehicle or on foot, to observe conditions or enforce rules.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以常规方式（通常步行或乘车）进行检查或行程，以观察状况或执行规则。
definitions.example_en: The coast guard patrols the shoreline to prevent illegal fishing.
definitions.example_cn: 海岸警卫队沿海岸线巡逻，以防止非法捕鱼。

comparison.analysis: “Inspect” (检查) 强调对某物或某地进行仔细、正式的查看，通常是为了评估状态、合规性或缺陷，不一定涉及移动或持续监控。而 “patrol” 强调在空间中持续移动的监控行为，目的是预防而非事后评估。
“Guard” (守卫) 指固定或半固定地保护某个地点、人物或物品，通常停留在一个位置。而 “patrol” 是动态的，涉及在多个地点之间移动，覆盖更广的区域。
“Monitor” (监控) 通常指通过技术手段（如摄像头、传感器）持续观察，不一定需要人员亲自移动。而 “patrol” 强调人员亲自在实地进行巡视，具有更强的威慑力和现场响应能力。
